patches.content:
Index: =================================================================== --- +++ @@ -3,9 +3,11 @@ function Rules() { return (

Rules of Minesweeper

-

The board is made up of cells, with mines randomly scattered across it. To win, open all cells that do not contain mines. Each number displayed on a cell represents how many mines are adjacent to it. Use these numbers to identify which cells are safe to open and which may contain mines. You can mark suspected mines by placing a flag with a right-click.

+

The board is made up of cells, with mines randomly scattered across it. +

To win, open all cells that do not contain mines. Each number displayed on a cell represents how many mines are adjacent to it.

+

Use these numbers to identify which cells are safe to open and which may contain mines. You can mark suspected mines by placing a flag with a right-click.

To start a new game, click the smiley face at the top of the board or press the space bar. The remaining mine count is displayed in the bottom-left corner, while the game timer is on the right.

); }

Index: =================================================================== --- +++ @@ -3,9 +3,9 @@ function Rules() { return (

Rules of Minesweeper

-

The board is made up of cells, with mines randomly scattered across it. +

The board is made up of cells, with mines randomly scattered across it.

To win, open all cells that do not contain mines. Each number displayed on a cell represents how many mines are adjacent to it.

Use these numbers to identify which cells are safe to open and which may contain mines. You can mark suspected mines by placing a flag with a right-click.

To start a new game, click the smiley face at the top of the board or press the space bar. The remaining mine count is displayed in the bottom-left corner, while the game timer is on the right.

Index: =================================================================== --- +++ @@ -3,12 +3,14 @@ function Rules() { return (

Rules of Minesweeper

-

The board is made up of cells, with mines randomly scattered across it.

-

To win, open all cells that do not contain mines. Each number displayed on a cell represents how many mines are adjacent to it.

-

Use these numbers to identify which cells are safe to open and which may contain mines. You can mark suspected mines by placing a flag with a right-click.

-

To start a new game, click the smiley face at the top of the board or press the space bar. The remaining mine count is displayed in the bottom-left corner, while the game timer is on the right.

+

The game board is a grid of cells, some of which contain hidden mines.

+

The goal is to reveal all cells that do not contain mines.

+

Each cell displays a number representing how many mines are adjacent to it, helping you determine which nearby cells are safe to reveal.

+

If you click on a mine, the game ends.

+

You win the game by successfully revealing all safe cells without triggering any mines.

+

You can restart the game at any time by clicking the "Reset" button.

); }

); }
